name: Casa De Mita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in May 2007 and just returned again this month. Casa De Mita remains excellent. It's changed very little, which is a good thing. In fact, many of the staff members were the same. This is just the place for relaxing with a loved one, in a beautiful environment with terrific service. This place is casual luxury - sometimes difficult to find but done perfectly at Casa De Mita.
reviews.title: Excellent the 2nd Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel does it All~and so well. It's a shame we couldn't give it a higher rating. In every way, from the moment you ring the bell at the front gate of Casa De Mita upon arrival, you start making vacation memories you'll want to duplicate again and again. It's slow, easy, yet elegant and oh, the food...! We consider ourselves fairly sophisticated world travelers with developed tastes for fine dining. Casa De Mita wowed us every meal; eclectic specialties like amazing eggplant appetizer to red snapper, perfectly done fillets or grilled scallops on a bed of chorizo. And the little extras like homemade breads and a wonderful selection of fine wines.
reviews.title: Casa De Mita deserves Six Stars!
perhaps the origin of "barefoot chic"......
reviews.text: Very quickly we became spoiled vacationing for a week at this resort where our room was cleaned not once but twice a day. With only 8 guest rooms the atmosphere among guests and staff soon becomes "mi amigos & amigas". And very soon we will be returning to our friends at Casa De Mita, hopefully bringing our extended family with us to enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at Casa De Mita twice within the past year, and eagerly await my next trip (and the one after that....).
reviews.title: Second time just as good

likes.liked: — The staff, the food, the other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa De Mita is simply perfect - a small elegant hotel, personalized service, and a perfect, natural beach.
reviews.title: Same time next year

likes.liked: — The wonderful staff and the delicious food and drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel met our requirements of quality service, fantastic food and wonderful accommodations. The staff has that fine line of intuitively knowing when to visit with you, when to be discreet and reading your mind for your next desire. Within a few hours of our arrival, they knew our beverage preferences (a difficult feat as there were 14 of us). We hooked our iPod into the pool's stereo system (though I must note the staff's music choices were rather good). They also graciously put up with my limited Spanish, even helping me learn new words.
reviews.title: Quality service in Punta Mita paradise

likes.disliked: — The humid weather (hello: it's Mexico in July!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was fresh and fabulous - I wanted to entice the chef to my kitchen. There was a choice of a meat (chicken or steak) and seafood at each meal; soup and salad were added with dinner. Exotic ice creams were available as well as these decadent chocolate truffles. One lunch included finger-lickin' bar-be-cued ribs and succulent shrimp kabobs. I'd love to have the recipes! The set meal-times posed no problem. We were able to order snacks when we wanted. During the day, we dined al fresco by the pool, with an ocean view. In the evening, we dined in the air-conditioned hut beside the pool.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place for a Fantastic Trip!

likes.liked: — openness of staff and other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All rooms have air conditioning and ceiling fans. You can choose which option you prefer at that moment. All the beds have mosquito netting. We liked to sleep with the windows open so we could hear the ocean. We splurged and stayed in the owner's penthouse. The king-sized bed is extremely comfortable - just the right mix of firmness and softness. It commands a sweeping vista of the shoreline. We had a television, DVD player and satellite in our room, but did not use them.
reviews.title: Best resort in Mexico!

likes.liked: — The Staff, The Food, The Beach, THE BEST!!!!!
likes.disliked: — That we had to leave this paradise on the pacific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeepers thoroughly cleaned our room daily - even adding decorative touches. All rooms have private balconies.
reviews.title: Perfect Beach Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dogs were extremely well-behaved. They escorted us on beach walks every morning and would lounge under the beach chairs.
reviews.title: Beware the Bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I normally do not take the time to defend a place that I would just as soon keep as my own private little secret, but after reading one of the only 2 negative reviews on Casa de Mita, I was compelled to speak up for this special home. I will not go into the amenity details because you can read that in any of the other reviews that do a great job of explaining the very thoughtful touches Marc has designed into this boutique 8 suite residence.
reviews.title: Our 4th trip kinda says it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our 4th trip, and I can assure you we are pretty picky about travel experiences. I am happy to pay a premium for a unique and quality experience and the entire staff at Casa de Mita makes this our home away from home. If you expect the flash of a major resort this is not your place. Not only is it not designed for children, they are not allowed and we like it for just that reason.
reviews.title: Tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our very first trip here in 2006, we vowed to not tell anyone about our little place north of Puerto Vallarta. The problem is, the secret is out. Punta Mita with all the posh of The Four Seasons and other new growth in all of Nayarit has made this a world class destination.
reviews.title: This place is unbelievable.
it felt like paradise
reviews.text: Casa de Mita will not appeal to everyone, and we like it that way. Do your research and if

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you are realistic about your expectations, Casa de Mita should be a place you will continue to enjoy for years as we do.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at Casa de Mita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't echo the other positive comments enough. This place is incredible! It is a 10 in every category possible- food, atmosphere, staff, beach, privacy, decor, relaxation, etc. We can't thank the staff enough for making our honeymoon an absolutely amazing trip. Like many of the other vacationers, we relied heavily on the reviews from this website when choosing our destination and let us say that we were not disappointed in any way. In fact there is no way that any description or pictures could do the Casa de Mita justice. We made friends from all over and of all ages and everyone loved the place. Have to mention, likes the other reviews, the food and drink. We have never eaten so well in our lives and literally looked forward to what each meal would bring. The drinks are equally as exciting. Hopefully we can stick to the vow we made when we left- that we return as soon as possible!
reviews.title: Unforgettable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked Casa De Mita for a honeymoon location, we really didn't know what to expect. So we went in with open minds -but our expectations were blown out of the water. When driving there off the main highway, you turn down a dirt road (which is a little off-putting). I was thinking, how can a beautiful honeymoon escape be off this road? But when we approached the casa, all my fears disappeared. We entered a beautiful - Bali decorated, impecably manicured-mexican retreat. We were told to go down to the pool and we were greeted by our new best friends, Mamo and Lalo. We were given fresh margaritas and guacamole. All the while, our bags were brought up to our rooms. Our job was just to relax. the facilties are beautiful-the room was stunning with mosquito nets, A/C, excellent view of the ocean, spacious balcony and the ability to shower while looking out onto the ocean. the pool was great too cool off in and grab a drink in the swim up bar. But my favorite part, was relaxing under the outside canopies while drinking a margarita or a lime drink. the beach right off the patio is beautiful and the food was excellent. Everynight, we had dinner overlooking the ocean while the sunset. I cannot say how much we loved the staff. My husband is an avid surfer and one of the staff members showed him literally, the best surf spots around Punta Mita. Also, one night we were down in Puerto Vallarta and there was no way we were going to make it back to Casa de Mita in time for dinner. So we called and Mamo took our order and said not worry, we can eat when we get there. they were so accomodating and i cannot wait to go back. we wanted to stay another night but it was booked up. Who ever gets to spend time here, is a lucky person.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon, Period!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa de Mita was more than we could have ever hoped for!! The place is super clean. The staff is always there to help, but never intrusive. The food and drinks were excellent and often made to order if you had dietary needs. We loved being able to get to know the other guests, but never felt like we didn't have our time to be by ourselves if we wanted. We will for sure be making many trips back to our new favorite place. I can say that I never thought I would take the time to write a review about a place I visited, but the fact Mark(the owner) and the staff made our trip so amazing, I felt it was the least I could do to let anyone know what a wonderful place you will find if you take a trip to Casa de Mita.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Wow. Totally awesome. Beyond my expectations. Great service, great location, loved the pool and swim up bar. My room was great, lots of space, nice terrace, huge bathroom, elegant and functional. No TV or phone in the room was a welcomed surprise. The hotel was big enough so I did not feel like I was in a bed & breakfast. Really nice and comfortable common spaces, indoor/outdoor living rooms, fabulous pool cabanas perfect for lounging and napping away the day. The service was awesome from the greetings at arrival to my sad departure – because I wanted to stay! The meals were included in the rate and they were excellent. No pressure from any of the staff but they were right there when you needed something. The meals exceeded my expectations each time. The hotel is on the beach and it’s great for swimming and walking. Overall, great experience. I will surely go back for another visit. Viva Casa de Mita!!
reviews.title: Wow. Totally awesome. Beyond my expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel is a gem. The staff, the food and the beach where just a few of the things that made our stay so special. But the hotel itself....Every wall and every corner of each room had some completely unique piece of art that made our stay the most fun and unusual vacation we have ever had..It is small, just eight rooms, but the other guest were like minded travelers who enjoy each others company around the pool our at breakfast, but also respect the quiet coziness couples crave when they sit in a cabanna overlooking the sea. Five days of food, drink, sea felt wonderful. Time truly slowed down and our stay completely recharged our energies. There was no reason to leave the property except to get to the airport. Anniversaries, weddings, small family reunions would be well taken care of by the wonderful staff at Casa de Mita. We`will definitely return next year. Mike and Marta
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations

likes.liked: — The all inclusive package with amazing meals
likes.disliked: — we had to leave to come home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have you ever walked into a hotel and felt like you were at home? Casa de Mita is like staying as a guest at your rich Uncle's house. At Casa de Mita you have wonderful people to help you with all your wants and needs. The staff at Casa de Mita are absolutely the best I have ever experienced. They truly are happy you are there and are quite happy to get to know you and honor any special requests you may have.
reviews.title: Outstanding Beach Vacation

likes.liked: — I liked everything about this place.

We are already talking about when we can go back. I highly reccomend this for a honeymoon if you want to feel like you ain your own secluded beach house.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to Casa de Mita--formerly Casa las Brisas--and it was as wonderful as ever. The villa itself is lovely--clean, beautifully maintained and perfectly appointed. Our room was a paradise with a lovely balcony and very comfortable room. The beach is pristine and private (no vendors) with fine, white sand and bathtub-warm water. I feel like many great hotels that are fortunate enough to be in exotic / paradise-like locations offer the above, but few have the warm and attentive staff and delicious food that Casa de Mita does. All the staff took wonderful care of us--amazingly, the same staff who was there during our visit four years ago. We never had to ask for a thing, they always anticipated our needs / wants. The menu offers something for everyone and can be instantly customized if you decide that you desire something special / unusual or more traditional. The food tastes incredibly fresh and delicious as do the drinks! One of the great things about Casa de Mita is that you set the pace--there is no scheduled eating times, no buffets, no times that the pool closes, etc. There is a small gym, office, library, movie room and spa services available onsite for those who desire it and kayaks, boogie boards, and surfing can also be done on the premises. We have traveled all over the world and can say with certainty that Casa de Mita is a jewel--it really feels like your own private paradise and we cannot wait to return. Do not pass this experience up!
reviews.title: AMAZING...can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 10 night stay with Marc and his staff at Casa de Mita. Everything about this place is perfection. Attentive staff, wonderful food, beautiful and romantic setting. Very easy to get to. Were picked up at the airport and arrived only 30 minutes later to the hotel. A beautiful setting, wonderful beach with views of whales breaching each morning.
reviews.title: A getaway in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A car is available for trips into Sayulita and Punta de Mita. Worth visiting to see local craftsmen and to try some authentic Mexican food.
reviews.title: Your life will not be complete without a visit to Casa de Mita

reviews.title: Perfect Place to Celebrate with Friends

reviews.text: margarita!!All our meals were terrific,service as well.
reviews.title: Perfect Romantic Getaway!
The cliche of "Paradise Found" perfectly suits Casa de Mita
reviews.text: Although Casa de Mita came recommended by a local, we had a quick check on trip advisor and this place intrigued me because there were NO bad reviews! How could that be? Well, it's all true. The location, the wonderful service (thank-you Memo, Lalo & Sammy!) the limited number of rooms (only eight), the great food and common areas were all designed to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. We had the added pleasure of meeting the other guests, who were a terrific bunch from all over the continent. The "welcome home" we received on arrival was a little misleading, since in my real home, no-one is there to bring me drinks (of any kind I desired at any time of day or night), offer me a wonderful selection of meal choices, change my linens, tidy my room and clean the shower on a daily basis! Frankly, after five georgeous nights, we really didn't want to leave. The only reason we did, is so that we can plan our return...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed a few nights at Casa de Mita. We loved everything about it! The location is beautiful -- on a fairly secluded stretch of beach; the public areas of the resort are lovely; and the rooms are decorated with Mexican art and furniture. The service was impeccable -- everyone at the hotel was so friendly and willing to help us with anything we needed. The food and drinks were delicious; most meals were taken with a gorgeous view of the ocean. We especially enjoyed eating dinner while watching the sunest. Since the hotel only has eight rooms, it is a very intimate place with personalized service. Everything is well orchestrated without being stuffy. We can't wait to go back for another romantic vacation! It is certainly not an inexpensive place to stay, but if you want to treat yourself to some rest and relaxation in luxurious style, don't miss Casa de Mita!
reviews.title: Casa de Mita is paradise

description: Luxury Mexico boutique villa style hotel ... located on a secluded white sanded beach in Punta de Mita just north of Puerto Vallarta ... Hotel is an ''all inclusive'' formula so that the emphasis is on service and quality of total experience ... A wonderful interpretation of Mexican charm and hospitality with casual elegance that appeals to all the senses ...
